alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 05 at 3:01PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Multiple Rounds of Heavy Rain will lead to Renewed River Flooding and Possible Flash Flooding Sunday into Monday... Two rounds of heavy rain and thunderstorms will impacts the Quad State Sunday into Monday. The first round of thunderstorms will impact southwest and southern Kentucky Sunday morning into the afternoon, as a cold front stalls in this area. Training thunderstorms are possible here, and a quick 1 to 2 inches of rainfall is forecast, with locally higher amounts possible. Another round of widespread showers and thunderstorms will move across the area Sunday night into Monday morning. This activity will yield another 1 to 2 inches of rain before ending late Monday morning. Several rivers are still above flood stage from previous rains last week. With a total 1 to 3 inches of rain expected, with locally higher amounts, rises along area rivers will occur. The latest river forecasts show secondary crests or a prolonged duration above flood stages expected at many gages currently experiencing flooding. There is also the potential for flash flooding, especially of poor drainage and flood prone areas. Thunderstorm activity could result in very heavy rainfall rates that could further tax drainage systems, especially if storms manage to train over the same locations. This hydrologic outlook serves to give advance notice of the potential of heavy rainfall that could produce some flooding impacts. Monitor later forecasts and outlooks if you live in a flood prone area.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
